data.enText: pleaded
pleaded
pled
pled
to ask sb for sth in a very strong and serious way
She pleaded with him not to go.

data.chText: 我被迫苦苦哀求给我的孩子一条生路。
data.enText: I was forced to plead for my child's life.
pleading eyes

data.chText: 他恳求准许他再看妈妈一眼。
data.enText: He pleaded to be allowed to see his mother one more time.
‘Do something!’ she pleaded.
to state in court that you are guilty or not guilty of a crime
to plead guilty/not guilty
How do you plead? (= said by the judge at the start of the trial)

data.chText: 他建议他的当事人以精神不正常作为辩护理由。
data.enText: He advised his client to plead insanity (= say that he/she was mentally ill and therefore not responsible for his/her actions) .
to present a case to a court

data.chText: 他们聘请了一位最好的律师帮他们陈述案情。
data.enText: They hired a top lawyer to plead their case.
to give sth as an explanation or excuse for sth

data.chText: 他解释说注意力分散是因为有家庭问题。
data.enText: He pleaded family problems for his lack of concentration.
to argue in support of sb/sth

data.chText: 她出现在电视上为所有政治犯声援请命。
data.enText: She appeared on television to plead the cause of political prisoners everywhere.

data.chText: 联合国已呼吁停止轰炸。
data.enText: The United Nations has pleaded for a halt to the bombing.

ex.chText: 当地的那个非政府环保组织恳请政府提供帮助。
ex.enText: That local environmental non-governmental organization pleaded for government help.

ex.chText: 那对双胞胎恳求苏珊留下。
ex.enText: The twins pleaded with Susan to stay.

ex.chText: 反对派领导人呼吁保持冷静。
你可以吁请董事会提供帮助。
ex.enText: You can appeal to the board for help.

ex.chText: 很多非政府组织都呼吁公众捐款。
ex.enText: Many non-governmental organizations have appealed to the public to donate money.

synonyms.bx: 指严肃、公开地请求给予帮助、信息、钱款等。

ex.chText: 她想冲到前男友面前乞求他原谅。
ex.enText: She wanted to run to her ex-boyfriend and beg his forgiveness.

ex.chText: 他跑到最近的教堂恳求帮助。
ex.enText: He ran to the nearest church and begged for help.

synonyms.bx: 指焦急、迫切地恳求，含有低三下四的意味。

ex.enText: She implored the landlord to reduce the rent.

ex.chText: 约翰，我求你快帮她，要不然她就要破产了。
ex.enText: John, I implore you, help her now before she goes broke.

synonyms.bx: 指焦急或动情地乞求某事物，或恳求某人做或不做某事，有时用于文学作品中。

ex.chText: 村民请愿要求地方政府提供更便利的医疗服务。
ex.enText: Villagers petitioned the local government to provide more convenient medical services.

ex.chText: 政府官员不明白为什么居民要请愿反对修建那条新道路。
ex.enText: Government officials didn't understand why residents petitioned against the new road.

synonyms.bx: 通常指向政府或组织请愿。

example: I pleaded with him to stop

tr: enter a plea, as in courts of law
offer as an excuse or plea
make an allegation in an action or other legal proceeding, especially answer the previous pleading of the other party by denying facts therein stated or by alleging new facts

value.def: If you plead with someone to do something, you ask them in an intense, emotional way to do it.

example.ex: The lady pleaded with her daughter to come back home...
example.tran: 这位女士恳求她的女儿回家。

example.ex: He was kneeling on the floor pleading for mercy...
example.tran: 他跪在地板上请求宽恕。

example.ex: I pleaded to be allowed to go.

value.def: When someone charged with a crime pleads guilty or not guilty in a court of law, they officially state that they are guilty or not guilty of the crime.

example.ex: Morris had pleaded guilty to robbery.
example.tran: 莫里斯已承认犯有抢劫罪。

value.def: If you plead the case or cause of someone or something, you speak out in their support or defence.

example.ex: He appeared before the Committee to plead his case...
example.tran: 他出现在委员会面前为自己辩护。

example.ex: He would plead the cause of Russian unity.
example.tran: 他会公开支持俄罗斯的统一。

value.def: If you plead a particular thing as the reason for doing or not doing something, you give it as your excuse.

example.ex: Mr Burke, pleading poverty, changed his mind...
example.tran: 伯克先生以自己穷为由改变了主意。

example.ex: Mr Giles pleads ignorance as his excuse...
example.tran: 贾尔斯先生把不知情当作自己的借口。

example.ex: It was no defence to plead that they were only obeying orders.
example.tran: 辩称他们只是在服从命令站不住脚。

value.tran: 提出…为理由；把…作为借口
